data.question: What is ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes?
data.answer: ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes is a simple local text generator for [ComfyUI](https://github.com/comfyanonymous/ComfyUI) using [ExLlamaV2](https://github.com/turboderp/exllamav2).

data.question: What text models does ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes support?
data.answer: Only EXL2, 4-bit GPTQ and FP16 models are supported by ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes.

data.question: How do I install ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes?
data.answer: Clone the repository to `custom_nodes` and install the requirements: `cd custom_nodes; git clone https://github.com/Zuellni/ComfyUI-ExLlama-Nodes; pip install -r ComfyUI-ExLlama-Nodes/requirements.txt`.

data.question: What are the ExLlamaV2 model-specific nodes?
data.answer: The ExLlamaV2 model-specific nodes are the Loader, Formatter, Tokenizer, Settings, Generator, Clean, Message, Preview, Replace, and String nodes.

data.question: How do I use a custom model with ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes?
data.answer: You should clone its repository or manually download all the files and place them in a folder in the `models/llm` directory. For example, if you'd like to download the 4-bit [Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct](https://huggingface.co/turboderp/Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct-exl2), you can use the command `cd models; mkdir llm; git install lfs; git clone https://huggingface.co/turboderp/Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct-exl2 -b 4.0bpw`.

data.question: What does the_Node_Footer tooltip in ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes developer do?
data.answer: The Node Footer tooltip in ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes developer provides information about the node, such as arguments and variable name differences, for quickly understanding how to use the node.

data.question: How do I add custom nodes to ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes?
data.answer: To add a custom node to ComfyUI-ExLlama Nodes, you need to clone the EllieJDC repository, add your custom node to the `nodes` directory, and edit the footer_dict.json file to add the node.

data.question: What are the Community Nodes?
data.answer: The Community Nodes are pre-trained models provided by the Syfl universe, allowing for the reuse of pre-processed sequences and explanations for various AI models.
